records.context_note: A migrant boat with 280+ persons was detected adrift in Tunisian and Maltese SAR zones. Rescue took over 17 hours, resulting in 7 deaths. FRO notes the need for prompt SAR coordination.
records.evidence_quote: A boat adrift was detected by a Frontex Surveillance Aircraft detected in the Tunisian SAR zone and later in the Maltese SAR zone with 280 + persons on board. The migrant boat was eventually rescued by the Italian authorities. During the rescue operations 7 people on board were found dead.

possible_violations.violation_name: the obligation to conduct rescue operations in accordance with international human rights standards and maritime law obligations, including disembarkation in a place of safety

records.context_note: A migrant boat with approx. 50 migrants was sighted in Tunisian and Libyan SAR zones. Libyan Coast Guard intercepted the boat, and physical violence was recorded during the rescue. Migrants were returned to Libya. FRO notes excessive force and concerns about disembarkation safety.
records.evidence_quote: On 02/06/2022, Frontex surveillance aircraft sighted in the Tunisian SAR zone an overcrowded migrant boat with approx. 50 migrants on board, headed north, into the Libyan SAR zone. Tunisian and Libyan MRCCs were notified. Three hours later, the boat was sighted in Libyan SAR zone, with Libyan coast guard boat conducting rescue of the migrants. Frontex aircraft monitored the interception of the boat and embarkation of migrants, during which it recorded instances of physical violence by the Libyan Coast Guard vessel's crew against the people from the migrant boat.

records.context_note: An alleged shipwreck with 110+ people was reported in Maltese SRR/Tunisian Territorial Waters. Maltese authorities denied responsibility due to location. Frontex assets were discouraged from attending. FRO highlights challenges in SAR coordination and state obligations to protect life.
records.evidence_quote: On 25/05/2022, Frontex Surveillance Aircraft team leaders (FSA TLs) diverted Heron 1 to an alleged shipwreck inside the Maltese SRR - Tunisian Territorial Waters based on information received from the Italian expert in EMT. Throughout the correspondence of the case, Maltese MRCC made clear that it had no duty to coordinate given the position inside the Tunisian Territorial Water with the Maltese Liaison Officer further insisting that a deployment of Heron 1 to the location would constitute a breach of the [redacted].

records.context_note: A wooden boat with 20+ migrants was sighted adrift in the Maltese SAR area. Maltese authorities were informed but denied responsibility. NGO Sea-Eye 4 eventually rescued the migrants. FRO notes the time elapsed between alerts and rescue, and Maltese authorities' refusal to provide information.
records.evidence_quote: On 12/05/2022 at 09:40 UTC, Eagle 1 spotted a blue wooden boat with 20+ migrants on board (overcrowded) adrift at [redacted] (reference: FSA [redacted]).
